intro: Melanoseris astorensis, commonly known as the Armenian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
